feed.title: mlog
feed.subtitle: A log of what happened in my lfe, machine-learning-wise.

entry.title: Podcast with Albert Bifet
entry.content:
In a podcast hosted by our marketing team, Albert Bifet and I discussed:

  • Elon Musk vs. Andrew Ng
  • industry vs. academia
  • GDPR vs. Algorithm Charter for Aotearoa
  • how NZ is world-famous in AI
entry.summary: In a podcast hosted by our marketing team, Albert Bifet and I discussed: Elon Musk vs. Andrew Ng industry vs. academia GDPR vs. Algorithm Charter for Aotearoa how NZ is world-famous in AI

entry.title: Webinar on the missing link for ML

link.title: Webinar on the missing link for ML

entry.content:
In a webinar called The missing link in the evolution of machine learning, I shared:

  • how “find my something interesting” is a bad question to ask of data scientists
  • ML models are only as useful as the actions you take following the predictions
entry.summary: In a webinar called The missing link in the evolution of machine learning, I shared: how “find my something interesting” is a bad question to ask of data scientists ML models are only as useful as the actions you take following the predictions

entry.title: My five cents on machine learning

link.title: My five cents on machine learning

entry.content:
I shared my thoughts on:

  • how to explain ML to a 5-year-old
  • what are some of the issues facing machine learning practitioners are facing
entry.summary: I shared my thoughts on: how to explain ML to a 5-year-old what are some of the issues facing machine learning practitioners are facing

entry.title: Where is the train? Choo choo

link.title: Where is the train? Choo choo

entry.content:
A product of a cross-functional team to produce a customer portal with ETA of cargo trains in the UK.

  • Our customer also posted a video on LinkedIn about how it helped them
entry.summary: A product of a cross-functional team to produce a customer portal with ETA of cargo trains in the UK. Our customer also posted a video on LinkedIn about how it helped them

entry.title: Helping tertiary students nationwide
entry.content:
The Tertiary Education Commission (TEC) initiated a piece of research on how to expand the predictive model we have previously built to more (even all) tertiary institutes in NZ.

We published a paper, which was presented at the 17th Australasian Conference on Data Mining (AusDM 2019) held in Adelaide, Australia.
entry.summary: The Tertiary Education Commission (TEC) initiated a piece of research on how to expand the predictive model we have previously built to more (even all) tertiary institutes in NZ.

entry.title: National press interview
entry.content:
Algorithms are everywhere but the public sector seems scared to use them interviews me as a public servant turned corporate citizen.

  • The article very much reflects what I see as the positive outlook of using algorithms in the public sector
  • I was worried about how the reporter would quote me out of context. But it turned out she was pinpoint accurate
  • It was also my first time being interviewed on national paper
entry.summary: Algorithms are everywhere but the public sector seems scared to use them interviews me as a public servant turned corporate citizen. The article very much reflects what I see as the positive outlook of using algorithms in the public sector I was worried about how the reporter would quote me out of context. But it turned out she was pinpoint accurate It was also my first time being interviewed on national paper
